comments:
Not sure who to file this against. I was attempting to synch with CVS when the
workbench stopped repainting. I closed Eclipse, but the task kept running after
the window closed (I had to kill it from the task list).

Attached is a massive log of exceptions that got thrown. Filing against CVS
since the first exception in the list was a CVS exception.

Created an attachment (id=10526)
Log from the session that crashed

Note: I'm using build I200405111200

The CVS exception is an authentication failure from a background job (which 
wouldn't effect screen painting). There seems to be multiple sessions in the 
log and I don't know which session is associated with the freeze. However, 
there do seem to be quite a few NPEs and widget dispose errors comming from 
various UI calls. Moving to UI to investigate.

The exception here is in this line:

 org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.defaultReplyErrorHandler
(MirrorImpl.java:260)

which is not in a Ui package (it is in debug).

The JDI "code 35" errors are covered by bug 46835, which are handled 
exceptions. The next exceptions that occurr are as follows. It looks like the 
first one in the list may cause others. However, the failure looks like its 
coming from the Javadoc view.

The javadoc problem has been fixed for I20045120800 though this is 100 pro not
the cause for the freeze.

Moving to Platform UI for final comment.

Dani not sure what you need from us here... you have fixed your problem so 
this is resolved correct?

Note: even once the original exception is fixed, there is still a UI or core
problem in that we should be protecting against this type of thing.
Updating the name to reflect what we need to do.

The failure occurs in WorkbenchPage.getViewStack(IViewPart).  This line: 
 
    stack[i] = findView(refStack[i].getId()); 
 
Can sometimes be called when refStack[i].getId() == null.  This is a bug in the 
presentation code, if anything.  My guess is that a partially initialized value 
is added to some list.  Just a guess. 
 
Re-assigning back to Stefan to fix.
There are no presentation-related classes in that stack trace.

Is this still a problem in 3.3?

PW
